PHARMACEUTICAL CHEMISTRY.Objectives:
To inculcate understanding of the properties and principles of medicinal agents that
originates from organic and inorganic sources and their application in pharmaceutical
industry.
 To provide the basic functional group identification, molecular rearrangement, chemical
bonding with their reaction mechanism.
 To provide the fundamental principles involved in the identification, preparation of
pharmaceutical aids and to apply the principle of coordination compounds in
pharmaceutical substances.

UNIT I STRUCTURE AND PROPERTIES: sub unit 2.1 : hybrid orbitals, polarity of bonds and molecules

SOCIAL WORK WITH INDIVIDUALS.Objectives:
1.	To understand case work as a method of social work and to understand values and principles of working with individuals.
2.	To develop the ability to critically analyze problems of individuals and factors affecting them.
3.	To enhance understanding of the basic concepts, tools and techniques in working with individuals in problem solving and in developmental work.
4.	To develop appropriate skills and attitudes to work with individuals.
5.	To identify the various situations and settings where the method could be used in the context of social realities of the country.

SOCIAL WORK WITH GROUPS.Objectives:
1.	To understand group work as a method of social work and to understand values and principles of working with groups.
2.	To develop the ability to critically analyse problems of groups and factors affecting them.
3.	To enhance understanding of the basic concepts, tools and techniques in working with groups in problem solving and in developmental work.
4.	To develop appropriate skills and attitudes to work with groups.
5.	To identify the various situations and settings where the method could be used in the context of social realities of the country.

SOCIOLOGY.Objectives:
1.	To provide the students of social work a sociological perspective on Indian Society, its structure and dynamics.
2.	To sensitize the students of social work to the pressing social issues present in the Indian Society.
3.	To enhance an analytical understanding among the students about the Indian society to aid in better professional practice.

PSYCHOLOGY.Objectives:
1.	To develop an in-depth understanding on the concepts of psychology.
2.	To understand the life span of individuals.
3.	To gain insight on various factors contributing for the personality of an individual.
4.	To facilitate the integration of above knowledge with social work practice.

FIELD WORK- I.Objectives: The field work during this semester is an overall design for providing an exposure to:1.The field of professional social work. n2. tDifferent fields of social work practice. n3. tUnderstand the basic skills required for the practice of social work, and N4. tTo encourage the learner to become a professional social worker.

SOFT SKILLS -I FOCUS AREA: PERSONAL & IN.Objectives:
1.	To enable the students to analyse their self and create positive self..
2.	To sensitize students to the nuances of the four basic communication skills- Listening, Speaking, Reading and Writing.
3.	To enable students to understand others.

SOCIAL WORK WITH COMMUNITIES.Objectives:
1.	To develop an understanding of the concepts related to working with communities and the processes involved in it.
2.	To make students understand the use and practice of community organization in various fields of social work.
3.	To provide the knowledge about the role of social worker in social change and social development.
4.	To familiarize the emerging trends and experiments in community organization.
5.	To introduce various aspects of social action as an effective method of social work.

SOCIAL RESEARCH AND STATISTICS.Objectives:
1.	To highlight the relevance of research for social work
2.	To study the various facets of the research process with special emphasis on Quantitative Research
3.	To hone the skills in undertaking research and in writing about the same.

SOCIAL POLICY AND PLANNING (For CD & MPS.Objectives:
1.	To understand the issues in social development.
2.	To gain knowledge of polices in India and planning process in India.
3.	To develop understanding of social policy in the perspective of National goals as stated in the Constitution and well as human rights and Development Goals
4.	To gain knowledge about the policy formulation process and acquire skills in critical analysis of the policies.

HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT (For HRM Speci.Objectives:
1.	To introduce the students to the basics of human resource management (HRM).
2.	To provide an overview of the functional areas of HRM.
3.	To lay the foundation for a deeper understanding of and practice in the field of human resource management.

BASICS OF COUNSELLING.Objectives:
1.	To introduce the students to the concept, definition, need for counselling.
2.	To impart knowledge to the students on the various models of counselling.
3.	To equip the students on the skills, techniques and process of counselling.

MANAGEMENT OF ORGANIZATIONS.Objectives:
1.	To provide an overview of the structure and administration of an organization.
2.	To impart necessary skill for the management of organizations.
3.	To provide an understanding of the policies and procedures involved in establishing and maintaining non-profit organizations.

SOCIAL LEGISLATION (For CD & MPSW Specia.Objectives:
1.	To enable students to understand the judicial system and the legal mechanisms for seeking justice.
2.	To impact knowledge about the various legislations available to deal with social problems.
3.	To make the students understand the mechanism of utilizing Social Legislation for social transformation.
4.	To expose them to law enforcement institutions and bridge the gap between the Criminal Justice System and victims.

LABOUR LEGISLATION - I For HRM Specialis.Objectives:
1.	To help the students to learn the fundamentals of Labour legislations.
2.	To give input to the students on the constitution and its relevance to Labour Legislations.
3.	To assist the students in understanding the legislations concerning Labour.

FIELD WORK - II.Objectives:
The broad aim of concurrent field work at this stage (First year – II semester) is to provide opportunities to the students for applying the knowledge and the information gained in the class room to reality situations. It also provides an opportunity to:
1.	Work with communities, groups, individuals / families and managing organization tasks.
2.	Learn skills through the practices of primary methods of social work (case work, group work and community organization).
3.	Inculcate professional growth and development.

SOFT SKILLS -II FOCUS AREA: LEADERSHIP &.Objectives: 1.	To enable students learn team building and conflict management skills using OBT (Out Bound Training) methodology.

SUMMER PLACEMENT.Objectives:
1.	Knowing about the basics of the working of an industrial organization / social welfare organization.
2.	Experiencing direct practice with the client systems and the management operations of the work of the setting.
3.	Integrating theoretical learning with the practice.
4.	Exploring the possibilities and areas for carrying out Research project to be carried out at the later stage of the course, and
5.	Experience self in the role of the professional worker.

COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT SPECIALIZATION RUR.Objectives:
1.	To develop in students an in depth understanding of Rural Communities.
2.	To provide knowledge of the various methods, Programmes, strategies and developmental efforts towards Rural development.
3.	To understand the role and contribution of professional social work in the developmental process.

DALIT AND TRIBAL EMPOWERMENT.Objectives:
1.	To understand the current status of dalit and tribal communities.
2.	To gain knowledge on the process of dalit and tribal disempowerment.
3.	To learn strategies and processes of dalit and tribal empowerment.
4.	To know about national and international efforts towards dalit and tribal empowerment.

COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT- APPROACHES AND TO.Objectives:
1.	To explore the various approaches in developing communities.
2.	To understand the tools used for community assessment, program implementation and evaluation.

WOMEN AND DEVELOPMENT.Objectives:
1.	To get an understanding of the perspective of women and development in Indian society.
2.	To understand the key issues faced by women and understand strategies to change the situation in terms of personal liberation as well as in terms of making women a part of the developmental process.
3.	To examine the social systems that affect women in meeting growth needs and special needs.

DISASTER MANAGEMENT AND ENVIRONMENTAL SO.Objectives:
1.	To develop an understanding of Disaster and Disaster Management.
2.	To help students to understand environmental issues and Movements.
3.	To enable students to understand the government and NGOs and the role of social workers in safeguarding environment and protecting livelihoods.

MEDICAL & PSYCHIATRIC SOCIAL WORK SPECIA.Objectives:
1.	To introduce the students to the concepts and historical development of the field of Psychiatry.
2.	To impart knowledge on the various psychiatric disorders and the role of social worker.
3.	To provide knowledge on Emerging researches in mental health.

MEDICAL SOCIAL WORK.Objectives:
1.	To introduce the historical developments of Social Work in Medical Settings, existing status and its development.
2.	To highlight a Holistic and Integrated approach to Social Work Practice in the field of Health.
3.	To develop a deeper understanding of common Physical Diseases and Health problems of the Community.
4.	To develop the capacity to perceive the relation of Environment and Socio Cultural and Psychological factors in the causation, treatment and prevention of diseases.

COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT- APPROACHES AND TO.Objectives:

2.	To understand the tools used for community assessment, program implementation and evaluation.

SOCIAL WORK WITH FAMILIES AND SENIOR CIT.Objectives:
1.	To help students gain a theoretical and conceptual understanding of families and family systems.
2.	To help students understand interaction, functions and issues concerning Indian families.
3.	To help students gain knowledge and skills in family interventions.
4.	To help students understand the needs of the senior citizens and programmes for them and acquire skills in working with senior citizens.

1.	To develop an understanding of Disaster and Disaster Management.

1.	To equip the students with the necessary knowledge on the statutory compliance concerning the labour force.
2.	To introduce the students to labour legislations pertaining to Industrial Relations and working conditions in the organised sector.
3.	To impart knowledge of labour legislations pertaining to wages, social security and welfare in the organised sector.

STRATEGIC HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT.Objectives:
1.	To introduce to the students the emerging field of strategic management.
2.	To help the student to understand the nature of the changing global business environment and the role of HR in it.
3.	To enable the students to appreciate the various methods and techniques of Strategic Human Resource Management.

ORGANIZATIONAL BEHAVIOUR.Objectives:
1.	To help students gain knowledge about the dynamics of human behavior in the organization setup.
2.	To enable them to gain understanding on the factors influencing human behavior in organization.
3.	To impart necessary skills essential for the management of human behavior in organizations.

EMPLOYEE RELATIONS AND WELFARE.Objectives:
1.	To provide knowledge on the employee / industrial relations system in India.
2.	To familiarize the students with the various employee / industrial relations processes.
3.	To give an insight into the concept of employee welfare & the societal and organizational responses thereof.

PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT.Objectives:
1.	To introduce the students to the concept of performance management.
2.	To train them in the performance management methods and techniques.
3.	To throw light on reward management

RESEARCH PROJECT – I.Objectives:
1.	To orient the students to field research.
2.	To develop their skills in research problem formulation and research field / area identification.
3.	To train them in developing tool of data collection.

SOFT SKILLS- III.Objectives:
1.	To facilitate the transition of students from education to workplace setting.
2.	To enhance the employability of students.
3.	To equip the students ready for the workplace.

PARTICIPATION IN PROFESSIONAL FORUM ACTI.Objectives:
1.	To facilitate students’ learning through professional forum activities.
2.	To facilitate professional networking.

COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT SPECIALIZATION URB.Objectives:
1.	To enable students to understand the unique nature of urban community.
2.	To develop sensitivity and commitment for working with urban poor.
3.	To provide knowledge on the government and voluntary efforts towards urban development.
4.	To equip students with specific skills and techniques of working with urban communities.

SOCIAL WORK WITH CHILDREN AND YOUTH.Objectives:
1.	To sensitise the students on the problems of children and youth in the society.
2.	To develop an understanding of the need and importance for child and youth development.
3.	To enhance understanding of the role of social work in child and youth welfare settings.

1.	To help the students to understand the health care system in India, health policies and legislative provisions relating to health.

4.	To learn  the art of report writing and Documentation.
5.	To develop a holistic and integrated approach to social work practice in the field of health.

4.	To acquaint the students about the avenues of employment both in the organised and unorganised sector.

LEARNING AND DEVELOPMENT.Objectives:
1.	To introduce the students to the basics of learning among adults.
2.	To provide an overview of the theory and practice of employee learning, training and development in organisations.

INTERNATIONAL HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT.Objectives:
1.	To introduce the students to the International Business Environment.

1.	To introduce students to the basic concepts involved in Compensation Management.
2.	To familiarize students with the various techniques used to fix salary, incentives, etc.
3.	To understand the different techniques of managing employee benefits.
